RoleDefinition.Title: Java Backend Developer
RoleDefinition.Description: A Java Backend Developer is responsible for server-side web application logic and integration of the work front-end developers do. They write web services and APIs used by front-end developers and mobile application developers.

WorkExperience.Title: Junior Java Backend Developer
WorkExperience.Description: Developed and maintained server-side logic for business processes. Worked closely with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic.

WorkExperience.Title: Senior Java Backend Developer
WorkExperience.Description: Led the design and implementation of server-side logic. Optimized the application for speed and scalability. Implemented data storage solutions and ensured high performance of request handling.

TechnicalAbilities: Proficient in Java and frameworks like Spring and Hibernate
Understanding of front-end technologies and platforms, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3
Understanding of accessibility and security compliance
Knowledge of user authentication and authorization between multiple systems, servers, and environments
Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure
Experience with containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes
Proficiency in database technologies, both SQL (like MySQL, Oracle) and NoSQL (like MongoDB, Cassandra)
Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps culture
Knowledge of unit testing and TDD (Test Driven Development)

OtherRelevantInformation.Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
Certifications: Oracle Certified Professional, Java SE 8 Programmer
Google Cloud Certified - Professional Cloud Developer
